data.title: GOAL
questions: In this phase, get them to clarify the goal and why it’s important.
What’s your goal? How would you describe your ideal outcome?
Is that specific enough? What exactly will you be able to do?
What would you like to happen that’s not happening now?
On a scale of 1 – 10, how critical is reaching this goal?
What makes this important to you? Why focus on it now?
By when do you want to achieve your goal?
How will you measure success?
What would success enable you to do?
Any other thoughts about your goal?

data.title: REALITY
questions: In this phase, get them to describe their current state.
What’s up? How would you describe where you’re at now?
(If not enough specifics) What exactly is happening?
What have you tried, and how is that going?
What’s going well?  What helped you make progress?
What’s your current thinking about achieving this goal?
Any there other perspectives to consider? Other ways of looking at this?
What’s your biggest barrier to moving forward?
What’s challenging about this barrier?

data.title: OPTIONS
questions: In this phase, get them to generate options—not offer yours.
How might you approach this? What could you do?
What action could move you toward your goal?
What else could you try? What if there were no constraints?
How do you think your role model would handle this?
What’s a strength or resource you could leverage?
Any other options you might create?
Reflect on and summarize the options generated.
Of these options which has the most potential to move you forward?

data.title: WILL
questions: In this phase, get them to flesh out one option, and commit to it.
(Assuming he/she chooses an option) What energizes you about this option?
What resources or support do you need to achieve your goal?
Where might you get what you need? Who might provide it?
How exactly could they help? How might you approach them?
What gives you the most confidence of success? How might you reinforce that?
What could prevent you from following through? How will you overcome that?
What will happen if you don’t follow-through? What’s the cost of not making it happen?
On a scale of 1 – 10, how committed are you to pursuing this option?
What would it take to make it a ‘10’?

data.title: PLAN
questions: In this phase, get them to identify how and when they will follow-through.
What would a plan look like to achieve your goal? When will you finish it?
What would make the plan a ‘10’ on a scale of 1 – 10?
What essentially is your plan? What’s your first step? Next?
What barriers do you anticipate? How will you handle each one?
What would indicate you’re making progress? How will you track that?
How will you hold yourself accountable? What would help you do that?
When would you like to follow-up? How often do you want to check-in?
On a scale of 1 – 10, how committed are you to this plan?
When will you get started?
What will you do first?
